textAfterTable: If we add  x squared to both sides we would end up with  .   Is this a linear equation?  Note how we have an x squared as opposed to x to the one power.  It looks like we cannot write it in the form Ax + By = C, because the x has to be to the one power, not squared.  So this is not a linear equation.  However, we can still graph it.   Step 1:  Find six or seven ordered pair solutions. The seven x values that I'm going to use are -3, -2, -1, 0, 1, 2, and 3.  (Note that you can pick ANY x values that you want.  You do not have to use the values that I picked.)
